thread.title: Area Football: Wildcats fall to Patriots, 41-20
thread.title_full: Area Football: Wildcats fall to Patriots, 41-20

title: Area Football: Wildcats fall to Patriots, 41-20
text: Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 12:01 AM Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 12:01 AM LONDON MILLS â€” The North Fulton football team led by one at the intermission but was held to a single touchdown in the second half of a 41-20 loss to Peoria Heights in a Prairieland Black Conference game on Friday. The Wildcats (3-4, 2-3) scored on a 12-yard carry by Jordan Stewart in the first quarter for a 6-0 lead. The Patriots claimed a 13-6 lead in the second quarter on back-to-back TDs. North Fulton scored its second TD when Paul Bailey found Cylas Krieger for a 25-yard pass with :35 left in the second for a 14-13 lead. The Wildcats scored their only second half TD on a 44-yard run by Cylas Krieger in the third quarter. Peoria Heights (4-3, 3-2) out gained North Fulton 406 yards to 254. Cylas Krieger led the Wildcats with 114 rushing yards on 12 attempts and two TDs. The Register-Mail
